title: Watch: Fraser Minten scores game-sealing goal for Bruins against his former team
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Fraser Minten scored a crucial goal in the Bruins' 5-3 victory against the Toronto Maple Leafs on Nov. 8, 2025.
Minten, who was traded from Toronto to Boston last season, notched his third goal of the season in his return.
The win marked the Bruins' sixth consecutive victory, with significant contributions from Morgan Geekie and David Pastrnak.

title: Bruins legend Zdeno Chara describes ‘surreal’ induction into Hockey Hall of Fame
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Zdeno Chara and Joe Thornton were inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame in November 2025.
Chara received his Hall of Fame ring in Toronto, celebrating alongside former teammates and sharing memories.
Chara's career accolades include a Stanley Cup win, seven All-Star selections, and the Norris Trophy.

title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox predicted to pursue top free agents like Alex Bregman, Kyle Schwarber, Pete Alonso, and Munetaka Murakami this offseason.
Boston has $219 million in payroll for 2026, $25 million below the first luxury tax threshold, allowing room to spend.
Besides hitters, Red Sox are also interested in pitchers. Predicted targets include Dylan Cease and Framber Valdez.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway, marking 20 years since his debut album 'Get Lifted'.
The concert featured a mix of songs, including covers and hits, showcasing his musical versatility.
Legend began his encore with 'All Of Me', engaging the audience in a sing-along to close the show.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officiating after Celtics' 123-110 loss to Magic, hinting officials influenced his fourth-quarter performance.
Brown previously critiqued refs after a 105-103 loss to Jazz, citing a missed call in the game's final minute.
Brown scored 32 points against the Magic, but struggled in the fourth, attributing issues to missed shots and turnovers.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Buccaneers, led by MVP candidate Baker Mayfield, have a 6-2 record with losses to the Eagles and Lions.
Rookie Emeka Egbuka has 562 receiving yards and five touchdowns, but faces challenges against the Patriots' man coverage.
The Buccaneers' defense ranks seventh in defensive DVOA, with standout performances from Jamel Dean and Antoine Winfield Jr.

title: Patriots’ return to relevance includes appearance by Jim Nantz in TV booth to call game for CBS
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jim Nantz and Tony Romo will call the Patriots-Buccaneers game for CBS, their first Patriots game in over two years.
The Patriots' improved performance, led by quarterback Drake Maye, has increased their significance in the NFL media landscape.
Nantz and Romo were initially scheduled to call Bills-Dolphins but switched to Patriots-Buccaneers due to Miami's poor season.

title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Boston Celtics lost to the Orlando Magic 123-110, marking their first defeat in the NBA Cup.
Jaylen Brown led the Celtics with 32 points, but struggled from three-point range, going 1-for-6.
The Magic's strong three-point shooting, at 47.2%, and defensive lapses contributed to the Celtics' loss.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph recommended for public reprimand for creating 'appearance of impropriety' in 2018 ICE case.
Massachusetts Commission on Judicial Conduct found no evidence Judge Joseph authorized escape of immigrant from courthouse.
Federal charges against Judge Joseph dropped in 2022, agreeing to state agency investigation; reprimand to be public.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox lost to Yankees in AL Wild Card Series, ending their 2025 playoff run with one win.
Manager Alex Cora remains optimistic about the team's future despite roster uncertainties and off-season changes.
Key players like Trevor Story and potential moves in free agency could impact the Red Sox's 2026 roster.
